description:
Approach

Read with Windows, which uses almost the same access.

Park the car on the Wolgan Road at about 429220, directly opposite Windows Canyon and cross the Wolgan River using a large log then climb up to the Rail Line/Old Coach Road and follow it to where it crosses Penrose Gully. Leave the Rail Line and climb up to the left of Penrose Gully (stay out of the creek line) angling towards the cliff line, then follow the cliff line around to the Penrose Gully exit slot at about 432206 and climb up onto the ridge at about 437209 and follow the ridge N for about 0.75km (there may be a faint track for at least the first part) drop off the ridge at about 438216 (use GPS to find this point so as to avoid a scrub bash) and head NW to the cliff line.

Descent

1. Enter the main creek system by abseiling about 29m from slings on a tree in the small creek on the RHS of the main depression at about 436217 with an abseil through a hole part way down the pitch (not the hole in the rock) – bridge out of the slot until you reach the lip of the hole

2. Second abseil about 20m into a small pool

3. Third abseil from slings on a tree about 20m through Hole-in-the-Rock. Stop on the left hand side of the ledge above the pool, unclip and turn to face the opposite side and then with hands on the opposite side and heels on the ledge edge across the pool.

4. Fourth abseil 30m from slings on a tree down a moist face – genuine 60m rope needed.

5. Final abseil 30m down a sloping rock face, from slings on a tree on the RHS of the creek requires a genuine 60m rope.

Exit

Follow the creek (stay out of the creek on the left hand side) down to the Rail Line/ Old Coach Road and then climb up some stairs where the creek has eroded the Rail Line and immediately after head back on a flattish ridge NNW to the car, crossing the Wolgan River on the large log.

Red tape

Beta sites

Trip reports and media

Background
name: Hole in the Rock
